tool_description:
Currencylayer provides an easy-to-integrate REST API with real-time and historical exchange rates for 168 world currencies and precious metals, delivered in lightweight and highly portable JSON format and compatible with any application, framework or language. 

Sign up for your free API Access Key at https://currencylayer.com/product
name: currencylayer
title: currencylayer

api_list.name: "list" endpoint - obtain a JSON list of all supported currencies
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://apilayer-currencylayer-v1.p.rapidapi.com/list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "apilayer-currencylayer-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://apilayer-currencylayer-v1.p.rapidapi.com/list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "apilayer-currencylayer-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: "live" endpoint - request the most recent exchange rates
api_list.description: Making a request to the API's "live" endpoint will return the most recent exchange rate data available.

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: "source" - the currency to which all other exchange rates are relative ("Source Currency")

api_list.name: "change" endpoint - request a currency's change parameters
api_list.description: Using the "change" API endpoint, you can obtain the "change" parameters (margin and percentage) of one or more currencies, optionally within a specific time-frame. Important: If you do not specify a time-frame, change parameters for "yesterday to now" will be displayed.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: "start_date" - optional - the starting date of the time-frame you want to specify (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: "end_date" - optional - the end date of the time-frame you want to specify (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: "source" - the currency to which all other exchange rates are relative ("Source Currency")

api_list.name: "historical" endpoint - request exchange rates for a specific date
api_list.description: Make a request to the API's "historical" endpoint providing a valid "date" in the format "YYYY-MM-DD"

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: The date you want to obtain exchange rates for (e.g. 2014-12-31)

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: "source" - the currency to which all other exchange rates are relative ("Source Currency")

api_list.name: "convert" endpoint - convert any amount from one currency to another
api_list.description: The "convert" endpoint lets you convert any amount from one currency to another using real-time exchange rates. If you append an additional "date" parameter, exchange rates of the specified dates will be used for your conversion.

required_parameters.name: from
required_parameters.description: "from" - the currency your conversion is based on

required_parameters.name: to
required_parameters.description: "to" - the currency you convert the specified amount to

optional_parameters.name: date
optional_parameters.description: "date" (format: YYYY-MM-DD) - perform the conversion with historical data from the date you specify

api_list.name: "timeframe" endpoint - request exchange rates for a specified timeframe
api_list.description: Appending a valid "start_date" and "end_date", the API's "timeframe" endpoint will return exchange rates for this specified period.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: "start_date" - the starting date of the time-frame you want to specify

required_parameters.name: end_date
required_parameters.description: "end_date" - the end date of the time-frame you want to specify

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: "source" - the currency to which all other exchange rates are relative ("Source Currency")
